item.title: C++ Forbidden Dark Magic: STMP (Part 2)
item.description: In the previous article, we gained a preliminary understanding of the principles of STMP and used it to implement a simple compile-time counter. However, its power extends far beyond that. This article will discuss some advanced applications based on STMP.

item.title: C++ Forbidden Dark Arts: STMP (Part 1)
item.description: As is well known, traditional C++ constant expression evaluation neither depends on nor alters the global state of the program. For any identical input, its output is always the same, making it considered purely functional. Template Meta Programming (TMP), as a subset of constant evaluation, should also adhere to this rule.
